contentrichtext.text: {{nihongo|'''Kinpō'''|金峰町|Kinpō-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Hioki District, Kagoshima|Hioki District]], [[Kagoshima Prefecture|Kagoshima]], [[Japan]]. On November 7, 2005 Kinpō was merged with the towns of [[Bonotsu, Kagoshima|Bonotsu]], [[Kasasa, Kagoshima|Kasasa]] and [[Ōura, Kagoshima|Ōura]], all from [[Kawanabe District, Kagoshima|Kawanabe District]], and the old city of [[Kaseda, Kagoshima|Kaseda]], to form the new city of [[Minamisatsuma, Kagoshima|Minamisatsuma]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipalities of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 8,099 and the [[population density|density]] of 112.10 persons per km². The total area was 72.25 km². ==External links== * [http://www.city.minamisatsuma.lg.jp/ Official website of Minamisatsuma] {{ja icon}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kinpo, Kagoshima}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Kagoshima Prefecture]] {{Kagoshima-geo-stub}}
